org.openimaj.ml.clustering.assignment.soft

Class ShortKNNAssigner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.ml.clustering.assignment.soft.ShortKNNAssigner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Assigner<short[]>, SoftAssigner<short[],float[]>

    public class ShortKNNAssigner
extends Object
implements SoftAssigner<short[],float[]>
    A SoftAssigner that picks a fixed number of nearest neighbours. Weights returned are actually the distances to the centroids.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShortKNNAssigner

        public ShortKNNAssigner(CentroidsProvider<short[]> provider,
                boolean exact,
                int numNeighbours)
        Construct the assigner using the given cluster data. The assigner is backed by either a ShortNearestNeighboursExact or ShortNearestNeighboursKDTree, depending on whether the exact parameter is true or false. If the parameter is true, then the resultant ShortNearestNeighboursExact will use Euclidean distance.
        Parameters:
        provider - the cluster data provider
        exact - if true, then use exact mode; false implies approximate mode.
        numNeighbours - the number of nearest neighbours to select.

      • ShortKNNAssigner

        public ShortKNNAssigner(short[][] data,
                boolean exact,
                int numNeighbours)
        Construct the assigner using the given cluster data. The assigner is backed by either a ShortNearestNeighboursExact or ShortNearestNeighboursKDTree, depending on whether the exact parameter is true or false. If the parameter is true, then the resultant ShortNearestNeighboursExact will use Euclidean distance.
        Parameters:
        data - the cluster data
        exact - if true, then use exact mode; false implies approximate mode.
        numNeighbours - the number of nearest neighbours to select.

      • ShortKNNAssigner

        public ShortKNNAssigner(CentroidsProvider<short[]> provider,
                org.openimaj.feature.ShortFVComparison comparison,
                int numNeighbours)
        Construct the assigner using the given cluster data and distance function. The assigner will operate in exact mode, using a ShortNearestNeighboursExact.
        Parameters:
        provider - the cluster data provider
        comparison - the distance function
        numNeighbours - the number of nearest neighbours to select.

      • ShortKNNAssigner

        public ShortKNNAssigner(short[][] data,
                org.openimaj.feature.ShortFVComparison comparison,
                int numNeighbours)
        Construct the assigner using the given cluster data and distance function. The assigner will operate in exact mode, using a ShortNearestNeighboursExact.
        Parameters:
        data - the cluster data
        comparison - the distance function
        numNeighbours - the number of nearest neighbours to select.

      • assignWeighted

        public void assignWeighted(short[][] data,
                  int[][] assignments,
                  float[][] weights)
        Description copied from interface: SoftAssigner
        Assign data to clusters. The results are returned in the indices and distances arrays. The return arrays must have the same length as the data array.
        Specified by:
        assignWeighted in interface SoftAssigner<short[],float[]>
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        assignments - the cluster indices for each data point.
        weights - the weights to the for each cluster for each data point.
